meanings.def: land that is under the control of a particular country or political leader
examples: enemy/disputed/foreign territory
occupied territories
They have refused to allow UN troops to be stationed in their territory.
The plane was shot down while overflying enemy territory.
The soldiers strayed into hostile territory.
The territory had been controlled by Azerbaijan for many years.
a town in British-occupied territory
former French territories
Their incursion into foreign territory is a clear act of aggression.

meanings.def: an area that one person, group, animal, etc. considers as their own and defends against others who try to enter it
examples: Blackbirds will defend their territory against intruders.
She seems to regard that end of the office as her territory.
Each of these gangs has its own territory.
The male establishes a territory and attracts a female.
The explorers set off to conquer new territories.
The territory was never densely settled.

meanings.def: an area of activity, especially one that is familiar/unfamiliar or somebody's particular responsibility
examples: This type of work is uncharted territory for us.
Legal problems are Andy's territory (= he deals with them).
The writer is back on home territory with his latest novel.
Tired of writing detective novels, she began to explore new territory.
The parties have been staking out their territory on education.

meanings.def: an area of a town, country, etc. that somebody has responsibility for in their work or another activity
examples: Our representatives cover a very large territory.
unexplored territory

meanings.def: a country or an area that is part of the US, Australia or Canada but is not a state or province
examples: Guam and American Samoa are US territories.

meanings.def: to be a normal and accepted part of a particular job, situation, etc.
examples: She has to work late most days, but in her kind of job that goes with the territory.

meanings.def: in a place that has no connection with either of the people or sides who are meeting and so does not give an advantage to either of them
examples: We decided to meet on neutral territory.

idioms.def: to be a normal and accepted part of a particular job, situation, etc.
examples: She has to work late most days, but in her kind of job that goes with the territory.

idioms.def: in a place that has no connection with either of the people or sides who are meeting and so does not give an advantage to either of them
examples: We decided to meet on neutral territory.
